medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Exertional dyspnea developed approximately 2.5 years before evaluation, worsening over 6 months. Two years prior, echocardiogram indicated moderate aortic stenosis. Symptoms included increasing shortness of breath at rest and a brief episode of syncope.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of hypertension, dyslipidemia, hypothyroidism, deep venous thrombosis after a motor vehicle accident 13 years earlier, asthma, hiatal hernia, and colonic polyps. Previous surgical procedures included resection of a malignant melanoma 5 years ago, hysterectomy, appendectomy, tonsillectomy, adenoidectomy, diskectomy, and arthroscopic knee surgery.
medical_history.family_history: Father died of myocardial infarction at 56; mother died from gastric ulcer hemorrhage at 61; sister had colonic polyps; brother had coronary artery disease. Children are well.
medical_history.social_history: Retired, lives with her daughter, independently performs activities of daily living. Does not smoke or consume alcohol.
